glsa.title: PostgreSQL: Buffer overflows in PL/PgSQL parser
glsa.synopsis: PostgreSQL is vulnerable to several buffer overflows in the PL/PgSQL parser leading to execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: PostgreSQL is a SQL compliant, open source object-relational database management system.

description.p: PostgreSQL is vulnerable to several buffer overflows in the PL/PgSQL parser.

impact.p: A remote attacker could send a malicious query resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the permissions of the user running PostgreSQL.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All PostgreSQL users should upgrade to the latest version:
